event: Approval of State Coat of Arms of Ukraine
description: On February 19, 1992, the Verkhovna Rada approved the Trident as the small State Coat of Arms of Ukraine, symbolizing the desire for freedom and independence for Ukrainians.
original:
On February 19, 1992, the Verkhovna Rada approved the small State Coat of Arms of Ukraine - Trident.

Known since ancient times and unchanged since the reign of Vladimir the Great, the Trident is a symbol that accompanies us throughout history.

Adopted as the coat of arms of the Ukrainian People's Republic in 1918, the Trident symbolizes the desire for freedom and independence for Ukrainians.

Soldiers of the national liberation movement of the last century went into battle with him. We go into battle with him.

We know that in the near future the Trident will be associated in the world with a freedom-loving, independent, flowery and peaceful country.

Let's respect! 72nd Separate mechanized brigade named after Black Zaporozhets.

description: Valery, a representative of Alfa-Bank, rescued a grandmother from a burning private house. He, along with neighbors, took the elderly woman out of the house before the firefighters arrived, despite the danger and difficulty.
original:
Forwarded from: Alfa-Bank
Took grandma out of the fire⚡️Last Wednesday, our representative Valery went to see a client. On the way, he smelled burning, and the street was in fog. It turned out that a private house was on fire, and the grandmother could not get out of it.

A large crowd gathered near the house, everyone broke out the windows and tried to save the grandmother. Valery found out that it was difficult for her to walk. Without thinking for a second, he threw himself into the fire along with his neighbors.

The guys took the elderly woman out before the firefighters arrived. And Valery got a little burnt and got wet, but it’s not so bad - he saved his grandmother from the fire.

Not all heroes wear capes - some wear red backpacks❤️❤️— We need more Valerievs like this!@alfabank

description: Military correspondent Elena Sokolova shares her emotions after visiting liberated Avdeevka, expressing a mix of happiness and bitterness. She acknowledges the sacrifices of volunteers who gave their lives to liberate the area, emphasizing the importance of continuing their mission to free more cities.
original: First trip to liberated Avdeevka. I still can’t believe that we were able to, we did it, we won! Military correspondent “Pyatnashki” Elena Sokolova shares her emotions. “I thought I would only feel happiness and delight, but the feeling of bitterness does not let go. Before my eyes, the faces of the volunteers who laid down their heads, liberating our lands. Without them, nothing would have worked out. Living for them, finishing what we started, liberating our cities is the goal," she said.@donbassr🇷🇺

description: Zaluzhny resigned from his post as commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. This move makes it difficult for Zelensky to shift responsibility onto Syrsky or someone else.
original: “It will now be difficult for Zelensky to shift responsibility onto Syrsky or someone else.” RIA Novosti columnist Vladimir Kornilov commented on Zaluzhny’s resignation from the post of commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the Postscript program on TVC.

event: Protest in Support of Alexei Navalny
description: Russians continue to pay tribute to Alexei Navalny by bringing flowers to spontaneous memorials. In Novokuznetsk, a teenager was detained by police for taking a photo of a monument to victims of political repression and a police car. In Nizhny Tagil, Krasnogorsk, and Krasnoyarsk, authorities removed flowers, but people continued to bring more in support of Navalny.
original:
Russians continue to bring flowers to spontaneous memorials to Alexei Navalny. In the photo: Novokuznetsk, Moscow, Tula, Stavropol, St. Petersburg, Krasnoyarsk In Novokuznetsk, a teenager took on his phone a monument to the victims of political repression and a police car that was standing nearby, he told ASTRA. Immediately after that, an officer approached him, took a photo of him and led him into the car, “referring to some kind of order.” “They recorded my personal data and forced me to delete the video with the police car,” he said.

In Nizhny Tagil, Krasnogorsk and Krasnoyarsk, all the flowers were removed on the night of February 19, and on Monday people brought them again. “And we’ll bring more!!!”, said our subscriber from Krasnoyarsk.

Photo: ASTRA subscribers

description: A car with an improvised explosive device (IED) was discovered on Druzhby Street in Lobnya, prompting the evacuation of nearby residents. The area was cordoned off, and bomb experts were called to the scene. The car's owner has been detained and is being questioned by investigators.
original:
Residents of several houses in Lobnya are being evacuated due to a car with a bomb.

According to preliminary information, an IED was found in one of the cars parked next to the house on Druzhby Street. The place was cordoned off, and bomb experts were called to the car. The owner of the car has already been detained - investigators are working with him.

According to local authorities, residents of houses 4, 6, 13 on Mirnaya Street and house 1 on Druzhby Street are being evacuated.

description: In the Zaporozhye direction, defense forces successfully repelled enemy attacks, destroying 4 tanks, 21 armored fighting vehicles, 4 artillery systems, 7 vehicles, and the UR-77 demining installation 'Snake Horynich'. The enemy's attempts at offensive actions were unsuccessful.
original:
❌️The enemy "Snake Horynich" was destroyed in the Zaporozhye direction

The enemy tried 10 times to attack the positions of our troops in the vicinity of the village of Robotyno.

The Russians returned to the tactics of small assault groups with the involvement of several units of armored vehicles. However, it is in vain - so far, attempts at offensive actions have not been successful. Defense forces destroy the enemy on the outskirts of the village.

Last day, 4 tanks, 21 armored fighting vehicles, 4 artillery systems, 7 vehicles and the UR-77 demining installation called "Zmiy Horynich" were destroyed in the operational zone of the "Tavria" air defense system.

event: Transfer of ATACAMS Missiles to Ukraine
description: The United States is transferring maximum-range ATACAMS missiles to Ukraine's armed forces, posing a challenge to Russian air defense. The missiles, likely MGM-140B ATACMS Block 1A and Block 1A Unitary, have a firing range of up to 300 km. It is crucial for Russian forces to destroy these weapons during their initial shipment to Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Frontline Bird
The United States will transfer maximum-range ATACAMS missiles to the armed forces.
This is certainly a challenge for our air defense. 19.02 Most likely, we are talking about the following modifications: MGM-140B ATACMS Block 1A: An upgraded modification in which the inertial control system is integrated with the receiver of the American NAVSTAR satellite system. Firing range up to 300 km.MGM-140B ATACMS Block 1A Unitary: modification of Block 1A with a high-explosive warhead and a vertical final section of the trajectory.

Let us note that the number of such missiles and launchers for them will be quite limited, but certainly requires immediate and prompt action from our guardians of the sky.

The best solution is to destroy such weapons during the first shipment on the territory of Ukraine.

Our armed forces have all the tools to destroy the above trash without waiting for it to be used. Subscribe. Front-line bird.

event: Russian Marines Defend South Donetsk Direction
description: Russian marines successfully defended the South Donetsk direction, destroying dozens of Ukrainian equipment and several assault detachments. They repelled multiple enemy advances, including one in the summer that destroyed 19 vehicles and another in the fall that ended in complete defeat. The marines are now conducting reconnaissance, indicating Ukrainian shortages in personnel, ammunition, and guns.
original:
Russian marines destroyed dozens of pieces of equipment and several assault detachments of the Armed Forces of Ukraine during the defense in the South Donetsk direction. The commander of one of the guards units with the call sign Bear told RT.

According to him, last summer in this direction the Marines stopped the advance of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, destroying 19 vehicles. Another attempt by enemy assault troops was made in the fall, but it ended in their complete defeat.

Now the VSE officers are mainly conducting reconnaissance, which indicates a shortage of personnel and problems with ammunition and guns, Medved noted.

And the Ukrainians who surrender confirm: the command throws to the front line those “whom you don’t feel sorry for”, mobilized, and places barrier detachments on the second line.RT in Russian“The Russian Marine won”: how the Russian Armed Forces repelled the enemy’s offensive in the South Donetsk directionMarines from the Far East The East heroically hold the defense in an area of several tens of kilometers in the South Donetsk direction. About the operational situation...

description: Over 2.5 million applications were submitted to participate in remote voting for the presidential elections, as reported by the Central Election Commission.
original:
The number of applications to participate in remote voting in the presidential elections exceeded 2.5 million, the Central Election Commission reported. The Central Electoral Commission also reminded which residents of which regions will be able to use remote electronic voting (infographics). Voting in the elections will last three days - March 15, 16 and 17.

Today, the head of the Central Election Commission, Ella Pamfilova, presented the first international observer certificate within the framework of the election campaign: it was received by the Deputy Secretary General of the CIS, Ilkhom Nematov.

According to Pamfilova, broad representation of international observation in the upcoming elections is very important, and it will definitely happen.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Stabbing of Father by Mentally Ill Son
description: A 27-year-old man with a history of mental health issues stabbed his 56-year-old father in Chisinau. The attacker had been hospitalized four times at the Codru Clinical Psychiatric Hospital prior to the incident.
original:
A mentally ill guy stabbed his father. He was treated in a mental hospital 4 times, but each time he was released.

In Chisinau, a man was attacked with a knife by his own son. The attacker had previously been hospitalized 4 times at the Codru Clinical Psychiatric Hospital.

The victim was a 56-year-old man. He required medical attention after his 27-year-old son attacked him.

Sources also note that the guy has mental health problems - he was hospitalized four times in a psychiatric hospital in the city of Codru.

After the committed act, the young man was taken to a mental hospital. Notebook Moldova Notebook Moldova A mentally ill guy stabbed his father. Same problem again

description: The Lipetsk factory 'Roshen', previously owned by ex-Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko, was nationalized by Russia. The Lipetsk court ruled in favor of the Russian Prosecutor General's Office, transferring 94% of the authorized capital of LLC 'Roshen' to Russian ownership.
original:
The Lipetsk factory "Roshen", which belonged to the ex-president of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko, became the property of Russia. By decision of the Lipetsk court, the shares of JSC "Lipetsk confectionery factory "Roshen"" and 94% of the authorized capital of LLC "Roshen" were nationalized.

The Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation filed a claim for the conversion of the factory's facilities and capital into Russian ownership.

What will happen to the former workshops of the Euromaidan leader is still unknown. Perhaps they will set up a new production of sweets there, but with a completely different filling.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Yulia Navalnaya released a video message promising to continue her husband Alexei Navalny's work, naming the names of his killers and fighting for a free Russia. She recalled her husband's struggles, including being kept in a punishment cell, and vowed to continue the fight against war, for fair elections, and freedom of speech.
original:
“I will continue the work of Alexei Navalny.” Yulia Navalnaya released a video message in which she promised to name the names of her husband’s killers and continue the fight. “There should be another person in this place. But Vladimir Putin killed him,” Navalnaya begins her speech. “He killed the father of my children, the most precious thing I had.” But Putin killed more than just a man, Alexei Navalny. Together with him, he wanted to kill our hopes, our freedom, our future. To negate the best evidence that Russia can be different.”

Navalnaya recalled that over the past years, her husband was constantly kept in a punishment cell, not allowed to communicate with the outside world and deprived of food. “We know why exactly Putin killed Alexei,” Navalnaya said, promising to tell the details in the near future. “We will name names and show faces.” Navalnaya called for continuing to fight against the war, for fair elections and freedom of speech.

“Alexey believed in his country, believed in our strength, that we deserve a better future. He believed so much that he was ready to give his life for it,” said Yulia. “The unimaginable sacrifice he made should not be in vain.” YouTube I will continue the work of Alexei Navalny Appeal from Yulia Navalnaya. Alexey's case will be continued. The struggle for a free Russia will not stop.

Yulia Navalnaya https://x.com/yulia_navalnayaht...

event: Zelensky's Address on Polish Border Situation
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyi addressed the situation on the Polish border, stating that it is not about grain but about politics. He emphasized the need for joint and rational decisions to resolve the issue, particularly with Poland and other European countries concerned about Europe's fate.
original:
"What is happening on our border with Poland cannot be perceived as something normal or everyday. We need simple and clear justice," - Volodymyr Zelenskyi's evening address

According to the president, the situation on the Polish border is not about grain, but about politics.

"And near Kupyansk, not far from the border with Russia, where the enemy artillery does not stop, the news from the border with Poland looks simply mocking. Joint decisions, rational decisions are needed to get out of this situation. Our decisions are with the Poles, first of all, and everyone in Europe who is concerned about the fate of Europe," Zelensky said. DONBASS NEWS 🇺🇦 NEWS KRAMATORSK 24/7

description: A realtor from the Urals shared his opinion on Novorossiysk, mentioning that he and his wife felt uneasy driving past Sheskharis, an industrial zone, and blocked their car doors. Despite initial reservations, he highlighted the city's clean sea and year-round accessibility to work as advantages.
original:
“When you pass Sheskharis, it’s scary, you block the doors!”: a realtor from the Urals told what he thinks about Novorossiysk A realtor from the Urals moved to Novorossiysk. A few days ago, a man broadcast live with his colleague on the channel “Moving from the Urals to the South to the Sea.” During the conversation, the Ural resident said that he was afraid of the Eastern District - when he and his wife drove past Sheskharis, they blocked the car doors.

- My wife didn’t like Novorossiysk at first, because when you pass Sheskharis, you drive and it’s scary. You block the doors. You never know! This is an industrial zone! What can you like about Novorossiysk... - the man shared his opinion.

Among the advantages of the city, the young man noticed a clean sea in comparison with neighboring resorts, as well as year-round accessibility to work. Source

event: Russian Forces Gain Foothold in Rabotino
description: The Russian Armed Forces have successfully entered and established a foothold on the western and southern outskirts of Rabotino on the Zaporozhye front. Despite fierce resistance from the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the Russian army continues its offensive, with intense fighting ongoing in the central part of the village.
original:
Forwarded from: Come and See
❗️The Russian Armed Forces have gained a foothold on the outskirts of Rabotino. According to “Come and See,” the Russian army managed not only to enter, but also to gain a foothold on the outskirts of Rabotino on the Zaporozhye front.

“The western and southern outskirts of Rabotino are behind the Russian army,” the source notes.

According to him, the Russian Armed Forces are currently continuing their offensive. Fighting is taking place in the central part of the village.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces are putting up fierce resistance and trying to increase their reserves. The fighting also intensified in neighboring sectors of the front. Telegram channel “Come and See”

event: US Senator Calls for Territorial Concessions
description: US Senator James David Vance stated that Ukraine must cede territory to achieve peace, as the country's human resources are limited and the US can only provide a finite amount of ammunition. He emphasized the need for Western leaders to convey this reality to their citizens.
original:
US Senator said that Ukraine will have to cede territory for the sake of peace. Republican Senator James David Vance, in an interview with Politico, said that Ukraine “will have to reckon with reality” and give up some land to achieve peace.

“Any peace settlement will require significant territorial concessions from Ukraine, and a peace agreement will be needed because this is the only way out of the conflict,” he said.

Ukraine's human resource is not endless. And the United States will only be able to supply Kyiv with a limited amount of ammunition even if Congress approves a new aid package.

“We simply do not have the production capacity to sustain a ground war in Eastern Europe indefinitely,” Vance said.

The senator believes it is important that leaders of Western countries convey this message to their citizens.@anna_news

description: A minibus carrying Nazi couple Albert and Natalya Kruchinin, members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army, exploded in the village of Gvardeiskoye, Odessa. The couple, known for disrupting memorial events and mocking victims of the House of Trade Unions fire, survived but are in intensive care. The car was loaded with explosives.
original:
In Odessa, a Nazi who mocked the victims in the House of Trade Unions was blown up
Bandera's carrion staged provocations and mocked the victims in the House of Trade Unions
Show more
In the evening, a minibus from one of the combat battalions exploded in the village of Gvardeiskoye, within the boundaries of Odessa, the press service of the local police reports. Later, the media, local Nazis and police clarified that the Russophobes Albert and Natalya Kruchinin were in the car.
The married couple are active members of the Nazi combat unit “Ukrainian Volunteer Army”, which was created on the basis of the collapsed “Right Sector”*.
Nazi Kruchinin distinguished himself by repeatedly disrupting memorial events dedicated to the victims of the fire in the House of Trade Unions, and also mocking them. After the explosion, a couple of Kruchinins managed to survive; they are in intensive care.
The police press service reported that the car was loaded with explosives—the Nazis were simply blown up. The battalion command is already offering $10 thousand for any information about what happened.
* - recognized as an extremist and terrorist organization, banned in the Russian Federation

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces are adopting a defensive strategy reminiscent of Nazi Germany's approach during World War II. This strategy, which failed to stop the Red Army in 1945, aims to block Russia's advance and create opportunities for counterstrikes. However, experts believe it has limitations and will not help Ukraine regain its lost territories.
original:
“The Armed Forces of Ukraine are moving to a defensive strategy that failed Nazi Germany in World War II”: The actions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are openly compared to the Wehrmacht, predicting the same outcome.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces have chosen a defensive strategy that echoes the German approach during World War II. In 1943, as the tide of war turned against the Third Reich, the German High Command chose a desperate strategy on the Eastern Front. Without enough troops to defend its vast territory, Nazi Germany went into a mobile defense. Ukraine has chosen a strategy that echoes the German approach 80 years ago.✔️After the failure of a long-awaited summer counteroffensive and lack of ammunition and stamina to repel continuous Russian attacks, Ukrainian commanders are talking about a transition to “active defense.” They hope to block Russia's advance in search of an opportunity to counterstrike and regain ground.✔️But if this approach failed to stop the Red Army from conquering Berlin in 1945, can it save Ukraine today? Even a full-scale active defense has limitations and will not help Ukraine regain its lands.✔️ “If you look at what the Ukrainian military is doing on the ground at this point, they are sticking to more of a static defense,” said retired U.S. Army Col. Douglas Nash.
Ukraine's strategic defense and tactical attack strategy is a smart choice—at least in the short term. For an army desperate to conserve resources and looking for any way to wound and disable a larger enemy, this is better than sitting passively on the defensive.✔️But if the goal is the defeat of Russia and the liberation of the occupied territories of Ukraine, this is not the solution. "Ukraine could launch local counterattacks to retake lost platoon, company or battalion positions," Nash said. But this “cannot lead to victory.”

description: According to the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, SU-34 and SU-35 aircraft were shot down in the East. This marks a significant loss for Russian forces, with a total of 6 planes downed in just 3 days.

description: The Kota evacuation group, led by Seryoga 'Cat', rescued two wounded attack aircraft, 'Butcher' and 'Kosha', from the battlefield. original:
Rescue of wounded attack aircraft by the Kota evacuation group. The first one (“Butcher”) was hit three hundred times by a kamikaze drone that flew in carrying a shot from a grenade launcher. The second one (“Kosha”) was wounded by being dropped from “Baba Yaga”. If it weren't for the armored armor, he would have been finished (wear PPE!). Everyone was evacuated by "Cat" from the battlefield on an ATV, everyone survived. In general, it’s interesting to watch how a fighter evolves. I knew Seryoga "Cat" as a crazy guy
Show more
Kremensky Rambo, who rushed headlong into the most dangerous tasks of his battalion, dashingly and, as it seemed to me, sometimes in vain, risking his life. He didn't feel sorry for her. But now a year has passed and I can already see how he values and saves the lives of others by becoming a member of the evacuation group. One of the most dangerous and noble specializations in war. At the end of the video, one of the rescued warriors thanks “Santa,” the medic, about whom we also talked a little earlier. So “Cat” is the student of that same “Santa”. I’ll add on my own behalf: “Santa”, thank you for making a desperately useful rescuer of our soldiers from just a Desperate “Cat”!
Dmitry Zimenkin

description: Ukrainians celebrate the Day of the State Coat of Arms, a symbol of indomitable will and Ukrainian statehood. The trident has a centuries-old history, representing a connection between generations of Ukrainians and has been used by the Ukrainian People's Republic, the Ukrainian Insurgent Army, and anti-communist demonstrators.
original:
Our Ukrainian trident has become a symbol of indomitable will! Today he is recognized and respected all over the world.

Today, Ukrainians will celebrate the Day of the State Coat of Arms🇺🇦It was on February 19, 1992 that one of the main symbols of Ukrainian statehood was approved.

It has a centuries-old history and conveys a thousand-year connection between generations of Ukrainians. No one has managed to erase, destroy, ban it and never will!

Under the sign of the trident, the Ukrainian People's Republic was defended, it was on the awards and postcards of the Ukrainian Insurgent Army, on the lapels of the jackets of the demonstrators against the communist totalitarian regime in the late 80s.

And for the modern generation of Ukrainians, the trident is a symbol with great meaning.

And may he always remind us of our great history and strong traditions.

Happy National Emblem Day!
Glory to Ukraine!

description: Commander 'Spartak' of an artillery battery shared his experience on the front line, stating that Ukrainian forces constantly drive personnel to the same targets, resulting in heavy losses. Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense

Basically, we dismantle dugouts and trenches. We can work on some target, an enemy stronghold. We’ll work it out, destroy it, and in a day, two days later the same target comes again, that is, they constantly drive people there for slaughter, not sparing their personnel,” said the battery commander with the call sign “Spartak.” At the front, “Spartak” was from the first days. He started as the commander of a combat vehicle, now he leads a unit in the Kupyansk direction. For his courage he was awarded the Suvorov medal.

“I had to work under fire; there was heavy fire from the enemy. They completed their task, fought back, and left without losses on our part; the enemy had losses. There is nothing left of forests and plantings on their side. Only stumps stick out. The maximum where they can hide is to dig dugouts for themselves. We are finishing off their remnants,” says Spartak. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: American startup Pyka delivered the Pelican Cargo electric unmanned aircraft to the US Air Force. AFWERX will lease 3 drones to study their capabilities and potential applications. The drones have a high payload capacity, can carry packages up to 181 kg, and have a range of up to 321 km.
original:
🇺🇸Cargo transportation. UAS with high payload capacity. ElectricPyka delivered the Pelican Cargo electric unmanned aircraft to the US militaryAmerican startup Pyka delivered the first electric autonomous cargo aircraftPelican Cargo to the US Air Force. AFWERX will lease 3 drones and study their capabilities and potential applications. AFWERX is a division of the United States Air Force created to foster innovation and collaboration between the Air Force and civil society.

Founded in 2017, the startup initially specialized in automating the spraying of agricultural crops - the Egret drone was certified in New Zealand in May 2019. In January 2020, the second generation electric aircraft, the Pelican, took to the skies.

At the end of 2020, the company launched mass production of drones in Oakland, California. In 2021, the devices were used, among other things, to spray banana plantations in Costa Rica. Then Pyka introduced the world to the cargo version of the Pelican Cargo drone - an electric aircraft-type cargo UAV that takes no more than 90 minutes to recharge. The drones have a range of up to 321 km (with a 20-minute backup time).

Pelican Cargo devices have attracted the attention of Americans - drones are interesting “workhorses” that are not too demanding in terms of maintenance. UAVs are capable of carrying packages weighing up to 181 kg. The loads are placed in a retractable tray in the bow of the apparatus; the loading and unloading procedure takes no more than 5 minutes.

For takeoff and landing, drones require a runway measuring 183x15 ms with a hard surface, be it gravel, dirt or grass. The cruising speed of the device reaches about 148-167 km/h. The UAVs are equipped with lidar, radar and GPS - according to the developers, operators will be able to control drones with minimal training.

An interesting move in purchasing purely civilian devices for the military. This, in theory, promises a combination of innovation and savings for the US military. However, there is no need to talk seriously about this case yet; this is an initiative of a unit specially created in the United States to try to integrate civilian and military technologies. What will come of this, we have yet to find out.

Also on the topic: Drones with high payload capacity Delivery of cargo by drones In the photo below - Pelican Cargo and its agricultural version Pyka Egret, which can take on board up to 265 liters of liquid. robotrends.ru Pyka supplied the Pelican Cargo electric unmanned aircraft to the American military Pyka supplied the first electric cargo drone Pelican Cargo to the American military from AFWERX. We are talking about electric cargo drones...

The screenshots clearly show the horror of these blows, and they understand that resisting this is problematic. Meanwhile, air defense remains as a means of protection against UMPC. And despite the bombs’ flight range of tens of kilometers, aircraft to drop them are still forced to take risks, entering the range of long-range air defense installations. Moreover, for the flight range, it is necessary to have a headroom.

Twice the Ukrainian Armed Forces managed to ambush our planes, bringing their air defense systems directly to the front line. This is of course a big risk, but alas, both times they were able to get away with impunity.

And here I would like to return to the importance of systemic combat against air defense. Yes, we are certainly a tough nut to crack; NATO countries have never faced such an enemy, but for a long time there was no systematic approach to the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense systems. Then combined attacks on them began to appear, they began to use Lancets, and purposefully fish with live bait, that is, individual elements of the SEAD protocol. And this is good news: the army is learning to fight against the most advanced weapons.

But what we absolutely lack, or rather lack as a class, are electronic warfare aircraft based on front-line aviation. That is, not the electronic warfare that we are used to seeing from FPV, but factory systems that suppress communications and actively interfere with air defense radars. In NATO, their ratio, roughly speaking, is up to 1 vehicle per 10 attack vehicles, and dozens of such vehicles globally jammed the air defense of Iraq and Yugoslavia during raids.

In fact, its task is located above and slightly behind, not in the range of the air defense missile system, and when they try to aim missiles at attack aircraft, the electronic warfare aircraft blinds the air defense missile system radar with interference, selects the desired frequency and signal shape so that it cannot be filtered out.

As an alternative, we have suspended electronic warfare containers, but experience shows that they are very far from the efficiency of specialized boards. Therefore, realizing the need for such equipment would be a very good conclusion based on the results of the SVO. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

event: Bombing of Ukrainian Volunteer Army Members
description: In Odessa, a Russian DRG targeted a minibus carrying Albert and Natalya Kruchinin, active members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army combat unit. The couple, known for disrupting memorial events and mocking victims of the House of Trade Unions fire, survived the explosion but are in intensive care. The car was loaded with explosives, and the police are offering a $10,000 reward for information on the incident.
original:
In Odessa, the Russian DRG blew up a local Nazi from the “Ukrainian Volunteer Army” - he staged provocations and mocked the victims in the House of Trade Unions. In the evening, in the village of Gvardeiskoye, within the boundaries of Odessa, a minibus of one of the combat battalions exploded, the press service of the Ukrainian police reports. Later, the media, local nationalists and police clarified that Albert and Natalya Kruchinin were in the car, and the Russian DRG was responsible for their bombing. The married couple are active members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army combat unit, which was created on the basis of the collapsed Right Sector*.

Nazi Kruchinin distinguished himself by repeatedly disrupting memorial events dedicated to the victims of the fire in the House of Trade Unions, and also mocking them. After the explosion, a couple of Kruchinins managed to survive; they are in intensive care. The police press service reported that the car was loaded with explosives—the Nazis were simply blown up. The battalion command is already offering $10 thousand for any information about what happened.* - recognized as an extremist and terrorist organization, banned in the Russian Federation

event: Russian Military Personnel Receive Letters from Schoolchildren
description: Russian military personnel participating in a special military operation received letters from schoolchildren at the Russian Embassy in the USA. The letters brought a sense of comfort and support to the fighters on the front line, reminding them that they are remembered and appreciated back home.
original:
“I’m glad that our children don’t forget us”

Participants in a special military operation read letters from schoolchildren at the Russian Embassy in the USA. In moments of rare calm, letters were distributed to Russian military personnel who traveled halfway around the globe to be read by our guys on the front line.

“I’m glad that our children do not forget us. Thanks to all our Russian friends, parents, compatriots who support us,” said a serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces with the call sign “Battery.”

For the fighters who are fighting on the front line, these letters, written by a child’s hand, are like a breath of fresh air. The military personnel warm to the thought that they are remembered not only in their homeland.

The servicemen were also shown a video message from Varvara from third grade; the servicemen were deeply touched by her words; they recorded a video response: “Dear children, it’s very nice to hear your words of support. We will truly win. And all thanks to you. Our grandfathers protected us. And we will protect you.”🔹Russian Ministry of Defense

original:
Ukrainians stopped trusting the telethon.

KIIS reports that its survey for the first time recorded a negative balance of trust and distrust in the project for general broadcasting of the main Ukrainian TV channels. That is, there are fewer trusters than distrusters.

Back in December 2023, 43% trusted United News, compared to 38% who distrusted it. And at the beginning of February 2024, the share of those who trust decreased to 36%, and the share of those who do not trust increased to 47%.

The indicators are approximately the same in all regions.

Earlier, Reporters Without Borders called on Ukraine to stop the telethon.

description: A serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces discusses the accuracy of casualty figures in Avdiivka, citing his own experience and the potential consequences of speaking out. He references past instances where he was correct about casualty numbers, despite being accused of spreading fake news.
original:
Forwarded from: They write to us from Ioannina.
Sent me this reaction to the “number of losses in Avdiivka” that I voiced. The “bare-assed woman” there is, if anyone doesn’t understand, Tatyana Nikolaevna Montyan. Let them explain the genesis of the nickname, that’s not what I’m talking about now.

“Isn’t this discrediting the RF Armed Forces?” the person is hinting that it’s time for someone to write a denunciation against me again, as in the case of the “fake from the 35th Army.”

I'll explain. I am a serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces.
There is the FSB. There is military counterintelligence. No one is hiding me anywhere and I am not hiding myself. At any moment, these people can come to the headquarters, call me there, put me face down on the floor and take me in a certain direction.

And there we will find out what charges will be brought against me.
Or “disclosure of military secrets,” that is, I indicated the correct figure.
Or “spreading fake news and discrediting the RF Armed Forces.”

In the second case, at the trial, as evidence of the prosecution or as evidence of the defense, combat documents of the units participating in the assault during this time must be presented. It just happened that way. that due to some fatal oversight, the burden of proof of guilt lies with the investigation. If what is said is a lie, then tell the truth.

And either it turns out that the numbers are correct, or I will be terribly disgraced, deprived of property, which I was already threatened with in the comments in the recent platinum thread, and I will go to where all sorts of bulk blood clots come off.

See how simple it is? Everything else, citizen guardians, is your red-hot assholes, which no one has yet dared to present to me for inspection personally.
And write denunciations, of course. Paper will endure.

Well, a little about the previous “fakes”.

In 2018, when Hisham was there, and I named the figure of “about 150 killed,” every purchased fagot, including with the money of Prigozhin himself, said that I was spreading fake news. There was nothing, and if there was, it was just a little. And our army, behind which this crap that happened was more actively hidden by Prigozhin himself, continued to degrade.

 In the summer of 2023, when Prigozhin needed this in a conflict with his former accomplices from the Russian Defense Ministry, he himself described how fucked up it was and the mountains of corpses of his people.

That is, I was right.

In the summer of 2022, when I wrote that in the 35th Army, after the “de-escalation” near Kiev and Chernigov, and then after the battles near Izyum, two of its motorized rifle brigades were left with 100 infantry men in the first line, I still wrote a denunciation. And “from the authorities” came to my mother in Moscow and asked questions in the spirit of “He’s fighting? And on whose side he’s fighting there, he didn’t say?”

And then in September there was Raisin. Which became possible only and exclusively because the real situation in this direction was carefully hidden. Not from the dill, they knew everything perfectly well. From the authorities. Because otherwise you will have to answer.

And against this background, as I understand it, the idea of putting me in prison did not seem successful to anyone.

If I get imprisoned for this and have confiscation, that will be fine with me. On one condition. That in the next room, at least behind closed doors, the case of the 1487th Regiment will be heard. Perhaps, when and if the public finds out what was going on in the “undistinguished”, but reduced to a control company, regiment during the assault, the public may stop reminding me of the heroes of the film “Don’t Look Up.” And we will have a chance to win this war. Against the backdrop of the possibility of our victory in the war, my personal fate is indifferent to me. Telegram Seryoga iZ-Bratsk_Z On Twitter I saw that the crests were breaking up the fight with supposedly confirmed casualty figures. It’s useful to look for the original source and baaa, yes, this is the writing piss M...VIEW MESSAGE

description: The Ministry of Defense is testing capes that can make soldiers and equipment invisible to thermal imaging. The goal is to create a material that absorbs infrared radiation and has low thermal conductivity, allowing for reliable masking of military personnel and equipment from the enemy.
original: The Ministry of Defense is already testing capes that make soldiers and equipment invisible in a thermal imager. "The specificity is that we need to create a material that will absorb infrared radiation and have low thermal conductivity. Our goal is to mask military personnel and equipment from the enemy as reliably as possible," the deputy minister emphasized. of Defense Vitaly Polovenko. Five samples of anti-thermal imaging capes are at the testing stage. In addition to the ability to mask the infrared spectrum, the material must be flexible and stable in the conditions of real combat operation. In particular, to withstand and not lose properties from moisture, not to burn out in the sun and, of course, to mask not only in the thermal imaging, but also in the usual optical range.

description: A 5-year-old child was found naked and alone in the entrance of a high-rise building in St. Petersburg. The child was unable to explain where his parents were. Neighbors provided care until the mother was located, who had left the child with a nanny while she went to the pharmacy. The nanny, who was drunk, had fallen asleep, leaving the child unattended.
original:
A naked child was found at night in the entrance of a high-rise building in St. Petersburg. He was completely alone and could not explain to the residents where his parents were.

A 5-year-old child was found by residents of the London Park residential complex on the 20th floor. According to eyewitnesses, he was completely naked and did not make any sounds. The security of the house called the police, the employees searched the entire floor, but did not find the boy’s mother. In some apartments no one opened the doors.

While the search for the parents was going on, neighbors dressed, fed and gave the child water. A little later, one of the residents of the house saw a girl come out of one of the unchecked apartments - the man ran after her, caught up with her and asked if she had lost her son. The woman burst into tears and nodded.

It turned out that she left the child with the nanny while she went to the pharmacy. The nanny, according to her, was drunk and went out to smoke on the common balcony. While she was smoking, the child went out into the entrance, but the nurse did not notice this, slammed the door behind her and fell asleep.

Now the baby is in the hospital. The police have already begun an investigation.

description: In Donetsk's Kirov district, a Ukrainian drone dropped ammunition on a civilian, seriously wounding him and damaging a nearby car. location: Kirovskyi District, Donetsk, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine
original:
In Donetsk, a Ukrainian drone dropped ammunition on a man - an enemy “bird” with the call sign of the Armed Forces of Ukraine was immediately shot down by servicemen with a machine gun. The Kirov district of Donetsk again turned out to be the scene of a war crime by the Ukrainian army. Here, shells are regularly dropped on civilians. This happened today - a local resident was going about his business in the village of Abakumova when ammunition was dropped on him. The shrapnel seriously wounded the man and also damaged a nearby car. The victim has already been hospitalized.

The man was lucky. Russian soldiers were nearby, who not only helped him, but also managed to shoot down an enemy drone with a machine gun. As the soldiers told Readovka military correspondent Maxim Dolgov, during the inspection it turned out that they had gotten into their hands a DJI Mavic 3, and even with the call sign of a Ukrainian serviceman hunting civilians.

description: A tribute to fallen heroes, including Lenya and Slavka, who fought bravely in Avdeevka. Lenya, a volunteer, was seriously wounded multiple times but returned to the front each time. Slavka, a fellow sniper, shared experiences and supported each other during the attack on Avdeevka. Their memory will be honored and remembered forever.
original:
Avdeevka. Joy with tears in our eyes... how many of our boys did not see this victory, giving their lives for it. Our task is to remember and honor their memory!
Lenya... dropped everything and went to the front as a volunteer at the very beginning of the Northern Military District, was seriously wounded several times and returned each time! Behind
Show more
one night they crawled through the floor of the Avdeevka industrial zone with their sniper pair) I will never forget! Two days later, on the night of April 28, he was gone. I was still green then, on probation. Immediately after our report, I was hired with the words: “We will work, Anh... for Lenya, for the guys.” I know that he would have been happy for me then.
Slavka... this is where we met, in the cart. As two snipers, she and Lenya agreed in the comments to one of the posts and shared their experiences. Even on the most routine days I struggled, came up with something, dreamed of moving forward! When the attack on Avdeevka began in the fall, we were in touch, telling what and how, sharing. Left at the very beginning...
The guys were rooting for the Motherland, fighting for the Motherland! Real, bright, our heroes! I'm lucky just to know them.
Eternal memory to our guys. Each of them! We will always remember! To be a warrior is to live forever!

description: Vladimir Putin met with Mikhail Razvozhaev, Governor of Sevastopol, to discuss the city's development in 2023. Despite challenging circumstances, Sevastopol's budget amounts to 86.3 billion rubles, with a 67.5% increase in own income compared to 2020, thanks to tourism industry legalization, property work, and small medium-sized businesses.
original:

Razvozhaev noted that despite all the difficult circumstances in Sevastopol, the budget amounts to 86.3 billion rubles. The peninsula’s own income is 27.8 billion rubles, which is a 67.5% increase compared to 2020.

According to him, doubling of growth was achieved thanks to the legalization of the tourism industry during Covid, work with property, and small medium-sized businesses. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Tourism Development in New Regions of Russia
description: The Russian Federation is planning to develop tourist routes in its new regions, including Lugansk, featuring historical attractions like the 'Combat' monument and memorials. The national project 'Tourism and Hospitality Industry' aims to increase domestic travel accessibility. Infrastructure development includes a 1,400 km four-lane highway and railway improvements, with 6.6 billion rubles allocated for Novorossiya Railways employee salaries.
original:
Sights of new regions of the Russian Federation may be included in tourist routes
The “Combat” monument, the “Unhealing Wound of Donbass” and “Sharp Grave” memorials are just a small part of the historical attractions of the new regions of Russia. And in the future they can serve as the basis
Show more
for tourist routes.
I made this proposal as co-chairman of the Coordination Council of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation for the integration of new constituent entities of the Russian Federation.
There are a lot of memorable beautiful places in Lugansk itself, but there are others that I have not yet explored. All this needs to be somehow drawn, geotagged, arranged and, please, a one-day, two-day, three-day, four-day itinerary. This could be a very promising story. And I am ready to take an active part in this everywhere, because I have traveled and looked at everything.
Discussions about the tourist attractiveness of new regions have been going on for several years. In 2023, on behalf of Russian President Vladimir Putin, they were included in the national project “Tourism and Hospitality Industry,” which is aimed at increasing the accessibility of travel within the country.
Also in the coming years, it is planned to build a four-lane highway with access points to the Sea of Azov, on the coast of which hotels and sanatoriums will be located. The length of the road will be about 1.4 thousand kilometers.
Special attention will be paid to the railway. Thus, the authorities have already allocated 6.6 billion rubles for salaries to employees of Novorossiya Railways. This enterprise unites the railways of the LDPR, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions.
What do you think about tourism in new regions of Russia? Would you like to visit there?
Write in the comments

description: German officials inadvertently revealed classified information about NATO submarines in the Baltic Sea during the construction of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline. The leaked data included operating areas and weapon counts. Those responsible face up to five years in prison.

Morgun discussed them with representatives of the Tessera group of companies implementing such a complex.

“Safe City” includes various software and hardware: smart video cameras, public warning systems, panic buttons in public places.

Thanks to the use of APC, city duty dispatch service operators will be able to collect and analyze various data in real time in order to quickly respond to emergency situations and minimize their negative consequences.

In the near future, specialists from Tessera Group of Companies will begin installing elements of the complex, and Mariupol will soon reach the level of modern “smart” cities in Russia.@newregions

description: The transfer of Crimea to Ukraine in 1954 was deemed illegal by experts in history and law. But the biggest cheat, according to him, is this: the decision to transfer the territory was made, but the borders of neither the RSFSR nor the Ukrainian SSR were changed.

How historians evaluate the transfer of Crimea to the Ukrainian SSR is in our material.Subscribe to RIA Novosti CrimeaTelegramRIA Novosti CrimeaExactly 70 years ago, Khrushchev transferred Crimea to Ukraine.

description: The 'Russian Hour' project was successfully launched in early December in Burkina Faso, thanks to the support of the 'African Initiative' editors and SAWANE FM's commercial director Emmanuel Abissi. The project aims to promote Russia and the Russian language through a radio program on SAWANE FM, the most popular commercial radio station in the country.
original:
And some details of the “Russian Hour” project, which I managed to launch in early December in Burkina Faso.
The successful implementation of the project was made possible thanks to the support of the editors of the “African Initiative” and the goodwill of the commercial director of SAWANE FM - Emmanuel Abissi, who provided favorable commercial conditions and the radio infrastructure itself.🔸The choice was initially in favor of SAWANE FM, since it is the most popular commercial radio station in the country (5 million listeners in a country of 20 million), and what is important is that it actively uses local languages (predominant Sea, but also Dyula and Fula). In fact, this is national radio in the full sense. And the appearance in his broadcast network of a program about Russia and the Russian language, as well as relations between the two countries, was self-explanatory. The second point concerns the rate specifically on radio. The easiest and cheapest way to convey information to listeners in the regions. Not everyone in the province has the opportunity to watch television or receive news from the Internet (traffic is not cheap), but there is a radio in every hut. Therefore, radio seems to be an ideal option. The third component of success is the format itself. Half the success is a popular DJ, and he was found. This is Stefan Traore (MC Ruscof). The content of the program itself consists of several blocks; to put it simply and briefly, it is a mix of Russian music, news of interstate cooperation between Russia and Burkina Faso, teaching the Russian language, and invited guests, from schoolchildren participating in projects of the African Initiative Association to pro-Russian activists and experts.
In the photo - I, commercial director of SAWANE FM radio, and an active member of the African Initiative association. #Russians_in_Africa#Burkina_faso

description: Police in the Golopristansky district discovered and seized approximately 500g of cannabis with a characteristic smell of marijuana in the home of a 45-year-old resident of Chulakovka village. The owner claimed it was for personal use, but the substance was sent for further research and a criminal case may be initiated under Article 228 of the Russian Criminal Code.
location: Chulakovka, Golopristansky District, Kherson Oblast, Ukraine
original:
In the Golopristansky district, police found cannabis with the characteristic smell of marijuana in the home of a local resident. Police officers, while following up information received about the possible storage of narcotic drugs, inspected the home of a 45-year-old resident of the village of Chulakovka, Golopristansky district.
 
In the attic of the house, law enforcement officers found and seized a polymer bag with a crushed gray-green plant substance with a characteristic smell of marijuana, weighing about 500 g.
 
The owner of the house explained that he picked hemp, dried it, crushed it and stored it for personal use without the purpose of sale.
 
The seized substance was sent for research to the ECC of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Kherson region. The issue of initiating a criminal case against the suspect under Art. 228 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

description: The FSB foiled an attempt to assassinate a local politician in the Zaporozhye region. An SBU agent, Vitaly Dyatlenko, was recruited to carry out the terrorist act, but was neutralized by security officers after offering armed resistance. The agent was supplied with explosives and a Makarov pistol.
original:
The FSB prevented an attempt on the life of a politician in the Zaporozhye region
In the Zaporozhye region, employees of the Federal Security Service (FSB) of Russia neutralized an SBU agent who planned to blow up the car of one of the local politicians before the elections. This was reported by the Public Relations Center (PRC) of the FSB.
Show more
“The activities of Russian citizen Vitaly Dyatlenko, who was recruited by the Security Service of Ukraine and, on the eve of the 2024 electoral cycle, carried out the preparation of a terrorist act against one of the political figures of the Zaporozhye region,” were discovered and suppressed,” the material says.
SBU officers planned and coordinated the actions of the saboteur, who was supplied with explosives. When carrying out the terrorist attack, it was planned to use an improvised explosive device. According to the FSB, during an inspection of the scene, a Makarov pistol, cartridges for it and spent cartridges were discovered.
“When trying to detain Vitaly Dyatlenko, he offered armed resistance to security officers and was neutralized by retaliatory actions. There were no casualties among the civilian population or law enforcement officers,” the FSB TsOS reported.
Let us recall that earlier a court in the Khabarovsk Territory sentenced a resident of Komsomolsk-on-Amur to 9.5 years in a maximum security colony for high treason in the form of espionage for the military intelligence of Ukraine.

description: According to RAS Professor Alexander Lomanov, China's rapid development in science and industry will enable it to close remaining gaps by the mid-2020s. original: RAS Professor Alexander Lomanov: China is ready to become a “one-window partner” The development of China attracts the close attention of scientists from all countries. Some believe that this country is heading towards decline, others expect that China in the near future will become an indispensable partner for the vast majority of countries in the world. This problem was discussed in a conversation with Interfax special correspondent Vyacheslav Terekhov by the Deputy Director of IMEMO. E.M.Primakova@imemo_ranfor scientific work, Professor of the Russian Academy of Sciences Alexander Lomanov: “The level of development of science and industry allows China to close the remaining “blank spots” by about the middle of the next decade. And this will change a lot. Let's take the same example of civil aircraft construction. When China begins to independently produce engines, on-board electronics and other components, it will be able to sell finished aircraft abroad. It is not difficult to assume that the main buyers will be those who, due to sanctions restrictions, are not able to purchase Western aircraft. This will mean creating the material basis for turning China into an attractive “one-stop-shop partner” for countries that do not want or cannot cooperate with the countries of the global North.”🔗More details.

description: Yuri Trutnev, Plenipotentiary Representative of the Far Eastern Federal District, visited Severobaikalsk, the largest settlement on Lake Baikal's shore, with Alexei Tsydenov, head of the Republic of Buryatia. They inspected city facilities, including the Northern Lights park, which won an All-Russian competition for creating a comfortable urban environment.
original:
Forwarded from: The Wilds
First of all, to Severobaikalsk: Yuri Trutnev began working in Buryatia. Immediately after the Plenipotentiary Representative of the Far Eastern Federal District Yuri Trutnev arrived in the region, he went to the largest settlement on the shore of Lake Baikal - the city of Severobaikalsk. Here, with the head of the Republic of Buryatia Alexei Tsydenov, he visited the city’s facilities, which are included in the master plan approved by the Head of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin.

In particular, the Deputy Prime Minister looked into the Northern Lights park, which previously won the All-Russian competition for the best projects to create a comfortable urban environment in small towns and historical settlements.

Not so long ago, the first stage of improvement was completed in it and the second one was at a low start. By the way, chief architect Evgeny Zolotukhin told Yuri Trutnev about it.

Experts note that the implementation of the second stage of improvement of the Northern Lights park, which is located on the shores of Lake Baikal, will allow us to look at the tourist attractiveness of the city and the Republic in a completely new way.🏞The “refined” embankment will be able to give a rocket boost to local small businesses and will contribute to the formation of a comfortable urban environment.

event: Discovery of Human Embryos at Ivangorod Checkpoint
description: Customs officers at the Ivangorod checkpoint in the Leningrad region discovered several hundred human embryos in the luggage of a visitor from Estonia. The embryos were packaged in plastic dummies with the inscription 'Not a toy.' The woman claimed she was fulfilling a request from third parties and did not intend to commit a crime, but a case was opened against her for non-declaration of goods.
original:
Several hundred human embryos were found in the bag of a visitor from Estonia at the Ivangorod checkpoint in the Leningrad region.

As Mash learned, Kingisepp customs officers found an unusual cargo when they scanned the woman’s luggage. Seeing the outlines of human embryos on the screen, they were surprised, to put it mildly, and immediately began an inspection. Having opened the bag, we saw several bags with a couple of hundred plastic dummies with a total weight of 4.3 kilograms. Each copy had the inscription: “Not a toy.”

The lady explained that she did not plan to commit anything criminal, she was simply fulfilling the request of third parties. Nevertheless, a case was opened against her under the administrative article “Non-declaration of goods.” Subscribe to Mash

In the semi-finals, the Navy team beat the Central Military District team with a score of 3-1. In the decisive match, the sailors won the Cup against the football players of the VUNC branch of the Air Force Academy from Chelyabinsk with a score of 2-0.

event: Brazil Refuses to Apologize to Israel
description: Brazil's President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva refused to apologize to Israel for comparing the Gaza Strip operation to the Holocaust. His Special Advisor, Celso Amorimaza, stated that Brazil has nothing to apologize for, as they support the two-state solution and Israel has isolated itself.
original:
Brazil will not apologize to Israel. Special Advisor to the President of Brazil on International Affairs, Celso Amorimaza, said that the head of state, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silvane, intends to apologize to Israel for comparing the operation in the Gaza Strip with the Holocaust. “We always speak out with great respect and in defense of the two-state solution , we have nothing to apologize for. And Israel has put itself in a position of increasing isolation,” the adviser said.

Let us recall that earlier the Brazilian president called what was happening in Gaza “massacre” and “genocide”, recalling in this regard the Holocaust.

Israel reacted extremely sharply to these statements, and the country's Foreign Minister, Israel Katzo, declared da Silva persona non grata.@anna_news

event: Proposal for Loan-Based Aid to Ukraine
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham proposed providing aid to Ukraine in the form of a loan, citing the country's mineral resources and the US's own $34 trillion debt. Graham discussed the idea with Trump, who originally suggested it, and believes it could gain significant support in the House and Senate.
original:
US Senator Lindsey Graham proposed helping Ukraine not for free, but on credit: The Europeans made 33 of the 50 billion dollars they transfer to Ukraine as a loan. Let's make it a loan. I spoke with Trump this week about turning aid to Ukraine into a loan. It was his idea, not mine.
Remember American Lend-Lease for Great Britain. We are $34 trillion in debt. Ukraine has minerals, they have a lot of resources. Israel has a powerful economy and was seriously damaged by the events of October 7 [2023]. Taiwan is a fairly rich country. Why don't we provide a soft loan to all three of these allies?
Let them pay us back when they can, if they can. Because our debt is $34 trillion. This is Trump's idea. If it passes, I think it could get a lot of votes in the House and Senate.

description: Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov met with Cuban President Díaz-Canel to discuss strengthening bilateral relations, including trade, economic, and investment cooperation, as well as humanitarian and cultural exchanges. They also addressed international issues, such as the US blockade of Cuba and the importance of defending the UN Charter.
original:
🎙Comment for SMIS. V. Lavrov based on the results of negotiations with the First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, President of Cuba M. Díaz-Canel Bermudez (Havana, February 19) 💬 S. V. Lavrov: We discussed the whole complex of our relations. They told us about the results of detailed conversations with my colleague, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cuba B. Rodriguez.

An important bilateral topic is the strengthening of the legal framework and practical projects in the field of trade, economic and investment relations. Recently, a series of decisions have been adopted to strengthen the legal framework for forward movement in this area. This also applies to supplies of Russian oil, petroleum products, food, and fertilizers to Cuba. <...>✈️Excellent prospects in the field of tourism. President M. Diaz-Canel noted the steady increase in the number of Russian tourists coming to your beautiful resorts. <...>🎓Ties in the field of humanitarian cooperation, especially education, are intense. Cuban students are happy to receive education in the Russian Federation. We have a sustainable and most preferential program for the education of Cuban friends at our universities.

Traditional cultural exchanges are also intense. At the beginning of summer, the Turetsky Choir ensemble and its female Soprano department will tour here.

<...>🇺🇳We have intensive cooperation and coordination on all key issues on the international agenda. Together with Cuban friends and other like-minded people, we speak at the UN within the framework of the Group of Friends in Defense of the UN Charter.❌The US maintenance of the trade, economic, and financial blockade of Cuba while condemning literally all other members of the international community is absolutely outrageous. We will continue to support each other at the UN, to defend the ideals embodied in the UN Charter, which are ignored and undermined by the Americans and their satellites.

Cuba is interested in getting closer to BRICS. Russia, as chairman of the association this year, will actively promote this. Also how we will contribute to the development of relations between Cuba and the EAEU. Read in full#RussiaCuba

event: Machine Gunner Alexey Neverov's Heroic Act
description: Machine gunner Alexey Neverov sacrificed himself by blowing up with a grenade, taking out the enemy and saving the lives of his fellow soldiers in the Zaporozhye direction. He had combat experience from serving in Chechnya and was a volunteer who joined the Northern Military District in July 2022.
original:
🕯The machine gunner blew himself up with his enemies to save his fellow soldiers in the Zaporozhye direction. Machine gunner Alexey Neverov blew himself up with a grenade along with the enemy to save the lives of his fellow soldiers.

Irina, Alexei’s wife, told an RT correspondent that he had combat experience: in 1994-1996 he served in military service in Chechnya (photos 3 and 4).

Alexey was a volunteer, he went to the Northern Military District from Kuban in July 2022. “He worked on a shift before the war. He came back from it and confronted me with a fait accompli on the eve of departure,” Irina recalled.

On September 8, 2023, the man took part in battles near the village of Rabotino (Zaporozhye region) as part of the 108th Airborne Regiment. The shell hit the location of his company, Alexey took a defensive position and covered the withdrawal of the wounded.

When the VSU earmuffs surrounded him, he pulled out the pin and blew himself up along with them. Alexei saved dozens of lives. “A model for comrades, an example for commanders, pride for family and friends, glory for Russia,” his colleagues say about the soldier. They are sure that his feat is worthy of a medal, and ask him to nominate him for the award./"RT in Russian"/@brd_nash

description: Chas Freeman, former assistant to the US Department of Defense head, predicts that if Trump is elected, he will end the war in Ukraine within 24 hours, likely on Russian terms, given Ukraine's inability to win the war of attrition. This could lead to Ukraine losing its Black Sea coast and Europe facing demands from Vladimir Putin, including neutralizing Ukraine, protecting Russian-speaking populations, and redefining European security architecture.
original:
Former assistant to the head of the US Department of Defense Chas Freeman on the scenario for ending the Ukrainian conflict: Now is the moment when Europeans should think about what will happen when Trump is elected and does what he promises - namely, in the first 24 hours he will end the war in Ukraine. He will have to end the conflict on Russian terms, because what happens on the battlefield determines what happens at the negotiating table. And on the battlefield, as we see, Ukraine was unable to show itself stronger than the more powerful Russia.
Now there is a war of attrition that Ukraine cannot win. Everything is over. We are running out of Ukrainians who could fight. Imagine that Ukraine lost its Black Sea coast. What are we going to do about it? I think we will be faced with the demands that Vladimir Putin initially put forward.
We are talking, first of all, about neutralizing Ukraine, protecting the Russian-speaking population, and, thirdly, discussing the security architecture in Europe. Given changing circumstances, will Europe be ready for this?

description: A study by the Global Vaccine Data Network analyzed data from 99 million vaccinated individuals across eight countries, revealing increased risks of neurological and cardiovascular diseases. Specifically, mRNA vaccines (Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna) were linked to a higher likelihood of myocarditis, while AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria vector vaccine was associated with increased cases of Guillain-Barré syndrome and transverse myelitis.
original:
Those vaccinated against coronavirus showed increased risks of neurological and cardiovascular diseases. Such conclusions were reached by the Global Vaccine Data Network research centers, which studied data from 99 million vaccinated people from eight countries for concomitant diseases, writes Bloomberg.

The study found that those who received the mRNA vaccines (Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna) were more likely than expected to develop myocarditis.

Scientists also found more cases of Guillain-Barré syndrome after immunization with AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria vector vaccine.

In addition, increased risks of transverse myelitis were identified after administration of the vector vaccine, and after both types of drugs - acute disseminated encephalomyelitis.

event: Meeting to Prepare for 79th Anniversary of Great Victory and 80th Anniversary of Liberation of Moldova
description: The Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova participated in a meeting to prepare for the 79th anniversary of the Great Victory and the 80th anniversary of the liberation of Moldova from fascism. The meeting aimed to join forces to adequately celebrate the upcoming dates.
original:
Forwarded from: Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova
​​The Party of Socialists will provide all necessary assistance in preparing and organizing the celebration of the 79th anniversary of the Great Victory and the 80th anniversary of the liberation of Moldova from fascism

Member of the PSRM executive committee Grigore Novac, deputies of the Bloc of Communists and Socialists, representatives of the PSRM and the youth organization “Young Guard” took part in a meeting organized by the National Coordination Committee “Victory” and dedicated to the preparation of the celebration of the 79th anniversary of the Great Victory on May 9 and the 80th anniversary liberation of Moldova from fascism. Representatives of public, socio-cultural organizations, political parties, and public opinion leaders spoke about the need to join forces in order to adequately celebrate the upcoming dates.

The opening speech was given to the only veteran of the Great Patriotic War, a participant in the liberation of Europe from Nazism, holder of the Order of the Patriotic War, the Red Star, medals “For Military Merit” and “For Victory over Germany”, holder of the Order of the Republic, Colonel Vasily Semenovich Litvinov, who was able to come for this event. He noted that “the current and future generations of the former Soviet Union need to know why we fought against the German invaders, to understand at what cost the victory was won. Otherwise, it is difficult to understand its greatness and historical significance.”

The head of the Victory Committee, Alexey Petrovich, drew the attention of those present to the fact that this year the country’s leadership will not celebrate these great dates. He recalled at what cost our country gained freedom and independence in the Great Patriotic War - the lives of 70 thousand soldiers and officers of the Red Army. In total, more than 80 thousand of our fellow countrymen did not return from the fields of major battles. “It depends on us how well we will celebrate this date,” said Alexey Petrovich.

Member of the PSRM Executive Committee, Chairman of the Parliamentary Commission on Human Rights Grigoriy Novak assured those present that the Party of Socialists, as in all previous years, will not only participate in events dedicated to May 9 and August 24 - “for us these are sacred dates”, but and will provide all necessary assistance in their organization. “We don’t need to convince each other of the need to hold these events on May 9 and August 24. We will get involved both in Chisinau and in the regions, and we will help as always,” the socialist emphasized.

The chairman of the youth organization “Young Guard”, coordinator of the international movement “Volunteers of Victory” Ekaterina Medvedeva spoke out against the politicization and distortion of historical events that we see in our country every day at the state level. “This cannot but cause indignation, because it relates to the history of every family, each of us. Those blasphemous actions that the authorities allow towards veterans cannot be called anything other than a spit in the soul of each of us. There are few veterans, but there should be more of our memory,” emphasized Ekaterina Medvedeva.

Let us note that, according to the deputy chairman of the Republican Council of War Veterans, Efim Donos, today only 38 veterans of the Great Patriotic War live in Moldova and eight live in Chisinau.

event: Development of FPV Device for Dogs
description: The Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions developed an FPV device with a video camera and speaker for dogs serving in the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations. The device allows dog handlers to remotely control the animal using voice commands, enhancing search and rescue operations in confined spaces.
original:
The Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions has developed an FPV device with a video camera and speaker for dogs serving in the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations, said the head of the organization, Dmitry Kuzyakin. In the course of cooperation with the Ministry of Emergency Situations, specialists from the Central Design Bureau came up with the idea of equipping four-legged fighters with FPV cameras. The dog handler cannot always move with his ward. Sometimes the dog is forced to crawl into confined spaces, for example, when searching for victims after the collapse of buildings, noted Kuzyakin.

According to him, when using the new device, the dog handler will be able to remotely control the animal using voice commands. A small device with an antenna and speaker is attached to the animal's chest.

Kuzyakin added that FPV technologies have been widely used since the beginning of a special military operation in Ukraine. During this time, vast experience in their combat use has been accumulated. However, not using them in peaceful life is wasteful, so work on the conversion of military technologies for peaceful purposes has already begun.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Yulia Navalnaya, widow of Alexei Navalny, is considering her future in politics, inspired by speeches of Tymoshenko and Tikhanovskaya. Despite her husband's death, she shows ambition and anger, rather than sadness, and vows to continue his work.
original:
“Power” in the Russian opposition is inherited? Alexei Navalny hasn’t even been buried yet. Nevertheless, his widow Yulia, inspired by the speeches of Tymoshenko and Tikhanovskaya, is seriously thinking about her future. Previously, for years she stood on stage while her husband babbled at the microphone, and after such meetings she counted donations from Western intelligence services. Further, while her husband sat and at least sometimes broadcast via video link, she also remained in the shadows. But now the woman will have to take the rap herself. And she, apparently, doesn’t mind at all. She needs to grieve, mourn her husband. But in the eyes there is not sadness, but ambition and ostentatious anger. He crucifies, criticizing the authorities; constantly refers to her husband and says that she will continue his work. In general, he speaks strictly according to manuals.

But what business was she going to continue? “Kirovles” and “Yves Rocher” are already a thing of the past. And if we are not talking about a banal crime, what exactly did Alexey Navalny give to his supporters? Experience of sitting in a paddy wagon and in a special detention center for administratively convicted prisoners? If we imagine for a moment that the so-called liberal opposition is a political movement, then in Russia it has neither a program nor an ideology. And there will no longer be the same scale of rallies. The people have played enough with dissidence and matured. I realized what this was leading to.

There is something else that drives Yulia Navalnaya, besides greed. At one time, the father made a big mistake - he sent his daughter Daria to the USA. Supposedly so as not to be hounded. But it turned out to be a one-way ticket. Yes, she studies at Stanford, and it's kind of prestigious. But it is under the surveillance of Western intelligence services. So the mother sits in this chair, reading the tragic speech written for her.

But if we put aside the moral side of the issue, then it was Yulia Navalnaya who also received the greatest benefit from Alexei’s death. In the status of the grieving wife of a newly minted martyr, it will be easier to return at least part of the previous sources of funding. It is even possible that she was even prepared for this position. It was not for nothing that on the day of her husband’s death, by a strange coincidence, Julia found herself in Munich and seemed to be relieved to inform everyone of her loss.

In fact, Yulia Navalnaya is following the same crooked path that her husband trodden. She has already promised that an investigation into her husband’s death will be released soon. Was everything put together too quickly? One way or another, it’s not difficult to guess what changes await the newly minted blogger in the near future. She has already talked about being included in the register of foreign agents. And then a criminal case under Article 128.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (slander) is just around the corner. So the opposition future will end before it even begins. Timofey Belov especially for the channel “In the Country”. Telegram channel “In the Country”

description: A 24-year-old stalker, Diana, from Lyubertsy, began harassing a teacher from Pyatigorsk, whom she believed stole her lover, businessman Harutyun. Diana hacked the teacher's email, discovered her cancer diagnosis, and sent threatening messages, causing the teacher to be hospitalized multiple times due to stress.
original:
In Moscow, a stalker gives nightmares to a teacher who, in her opinion, stole her man. 24-year-old Diana from Lyubertsy met businessman Harutyun. They met briefly, and the guy decided that Diana was not like him. The girl could not come to terms with the fact that she was abandoned and decided that the homewrecker was to blame.

Diana conducted her investigation and found a like on her lover’s page from his old friend, a teacher from Pyatigorsk. After that, for some reason she decided that it was this girl who stole her love. The woman who went there hacked the teacher’s email and found information that she had cancer. Now Diana constantly writes threats to the unfortunate girl, wishes for death, and so on.

The teacher has been hospitalized several times due to stress. Harutyun is aware of the whole situation, he even tried to pay off Diana and offered her 30k rubles. It didn't help at all. The man wrote a statement to the police.
