event: Proposal for Loan-Based Aid to Ukraine
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham suggested providing aid to Ukraine in the form of a loan, citing the country's mineral resources. He referenced the American Lend-Lease program for Great Britain and proposed a similar approach for Ukraine, Israel, and Taiwan, allowing them to repay the loans when possible.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
US Senator Lindsey Graham proposed helping Ukraine not for free, but on credit: The Europeans made 33 of the 50 billion dollars they transfer to Ukraine as a loan. Let's make it a loan. I spoke with Trump this week about turning aid to Ukraine into a loan. It was his idea, not mine.
Remember American Lend-Lease for Great Britain. We are $34 trillion in debt. Ukraine has minerals, they have a lot of resources. Israel has a powerful economy and was seriously damaged by the events of October 7 [2023]. Taiwan is a fairly rich country. Why don't we provide a soft loan to all three of these allies?
Let them pay us back when they can, if they can. Because our debt is $34 trillion. This is Trump's idea. If it passes, I think it could get a lot of votes in the House and Senate.

event: Guidelines for Radio Stations on Navalny's Death
description: Regional radio stations received manuals advising presenters to focus on federal radio broadcasts, central TV channels, and official Russian sources when discussing Alexei Navalny's death. They are instructed to avoid escalating or scaring listeners, and to exclude fake news and Telegram channels.
original:
Regional radio stations received manuals with recommendations “not to escalate or scare” when talking about the death of Alexei Navalny. Examples of letters sent to employees of the Avtoradio and Europe Plus networks are published by the Sirena publication.

Newscast presenters are advised to focus on federal radio broadcasts, central television channels, as well as official Russian sources.

The authors of the letters include “reactions and statements of various departments and officials - the Federal Penitentiary Service, the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation, the Kremlin, etc.” to the latter. As well as such media as TASS, RIA Novosti, Channel One, Lenta.ru, Izvestia and RT. “We do not push or scare the townspeople. Without panic and any personal assessment of what is happening, opinions and comments (in this case, Western leaders). No announcements of possible rallies,” the letter emphasizes to “Europe Plus” employees. Presenters are also recommended to “exclude fakes and telegram channels.”

In examples of “correct” news about Navalny that have already been broadcast, the politician is called a “blogger,” and listeners’ attention is focused on the articles for which Alexei Navalny was convicted—in particular, cases of “extremism” and “fraud.”

———Screenshots: “Siren”.

event: Decline of Trust in United News
description: According to a KIIS survey, the trust in United News, a Ukrainian TV channel, has declined. In December 2023, 43% of respondents trusted the channel, while 38% did not. By February 2024, the trust level dropped to 36%, with 47% expressing distrust.
original:
Ukrainians FINALLY stopped trusting the telethon. KIIS reports that its survey for the first time recorded a negative balance of trust/distrust in the project of general broadcasting of the main Ukrainian TV channels. That is, there are fewer people who trust than those who do not trust the media “mouthpiece of Bankova”.

Back in December 2023, 43% trusted United News, compared to 38% who did not. And at the beginning of February 2024, the share of those who trust decreased to 36%, and the share of those who do not trust increased to 47%.

The indicators are approximately the same in all regions.

description: The Kota evacuation group rescued two wounded attack aircraft, 'Butcher' and 'Kosha', from the battlefield. 'Butcher' was hit 300 times by a kamikaze drone, while 'Kosha' was wounded by a 'Baba Yaga' attack. Thanks to their armored armor and the evacuation efforts, everyone survived. The rescue was carried out by 'Cat' on an ATV, who is a student of medic 'Santa'.
original: Rescue of wounded attack aircraft by the Kota evacuation group. The first one (“Butcher”) was hit three hundred times by a kamikaze drone that flew in carrying a shot from a grenade launcher. The second one (“Kosha”) was wounded by being dropped from “Baba Yaga”. If it weren't for the armored armor, he would have been finished (wear PPE!). Everyone was evacuated by "Cat" from the battlefield on an ATV, everyone survived. In general, it’s interesting to watch how a fighter evolves. I knew Seryoga “Kot” as the reckless Kremensky Rambo, who rushed headlong into the most dangerous tasks of his battalion, dashingly and, as it seemed to me, sometimes in vain, risking his life. He didn't feel sorry for her. But now a year has passed and I can already see how he values and saves the lives of others by becoming a member of the evacuation group. One of the most dangerous and noble specializations in war. At the end of the video, one of the rescued warriors thanks “Santa,” the medic, about whom we also talked a little earlier. So “Cat” is the student of that same “Santa”. On my own behalf, I’ll add: “Santa”, thank you for making a desperately useful rescuer of our soldiers out of just a Desperate “Cat”! Dmitry Zimenkin https://vk.com/video598845262_456239987

description: The Spanish Police Department has not confirmed the identity of the murdered man as defector Maxim Kuzmin. Discrepancies in age and lack of credible sources raise doubts about the authenticity of the report.
original:
Forwarded from: GRAY ZONE
Based on additional materials that appear in the Western press, it is still worth suggesting that the death of defector Maxim Kuzmin is not even a staging, but simply a stuffing of information that does not correspond to reality.

The Spanish Police Department has not yet confirmed that the identity of the murdered man is Kuzmin. Also, according to some sources, the age of the corpse and Kuzmin does not match - 28 and 33 years.

Despite the passage of several days since the execution of the “unknown” in Spain, the primary source is Eureka News, which itself, in turn, refers to unofficial information. The original source does not have a website, only an account on X (formerly Twitter) and a telegram channel. Therefore, most likely, the identity of the person killed/died in the Spanish city has nothing to do with the defector Maxim Kuzmin. https://t.me/grey_zone/22022TelegramGREY ZONE A number of European information publications, including the rather authoritative ABC, report that, in Spanish town of La Villajoyosa in Alicante was...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Discovery of Red Army Soldiers' Remains
description: The remains of eight Red Army soldiers were discovered in Geroevskoye, near Kerch, due to a storm that eroded the sandy shore, exposing the burial site. This is the second such discovery in the area, with the first being in December 2023. Only a few personal belongings, including coins, buttons, and belt fragments, were found.
original: It could not have happened without the help of the elements: the remains of eight Red Army soldiers were found in Geroevskoye near Kerch. This is not the first case. In December 2023, 11 Soviet soldiers were raised here. And now, two months later, a storm, eroding the sandy shore, exposed the burial. In this place, no metal objects were found in either the sanitary burial or the second. Therefore, there was practically no chance of finding them, if not for the elements. Of the personal belongings, only a few coins, buttons from an overcoat and fragments of a belt were found. The work of the search engines does not stop for a day. Local residents also help. But there is a danger: a storm collapses the shore near the monument and mass grave. There are 1.5 meters left to the stele. It is impossible to predict how long the sandy shore will last. The sea in this bay is so unpredictable that the terrain changes literally every day. City authorities are looking for ways to prevent destruction. Read more in our storyCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

I'll pour one for you, Alexey. Thank you for everything,” Roher wrote on his Instagram. Roher previously stated that Vladimir Putin was responsible for Navalny’s death. In 2023, Roher’s film “Navalny” received an Oscar in the “Best Documentary Film” category. Roher filmed Alexei Navalny over the course of several weeks from the moment he emerged from his coma after poisoning until he boarded the flight he took back to Russia.

description: The latest issue of Fisherman Comics, No. 14, explores the theme of foreigners in the Russian and Ukrainian armed forces. The comic tells the story of Ernesto, a Cuban volunteer who joins the Russian forces and forms strong bonds with his comrades.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
⚡️🇷🇺🇺🇦🖍#Fisherman Comics No. 14: Once upon a time near Artyomovsk The new week begins with a new issue of our comic: this time we decided to touch on the topic of foreigners in the ranks of the Russian Armed Forces and Ukrainian formations. It would seem that here and there there are people from abroad who find themselves on opposite sides of the barricades.

But there is always a difference: first of all, it is a question of motivation and the reasons that prompted people to take part in someone else’s conflict. Synopsis: The circle of communication and connections that we form with people are certainly important and have an influence on us that is difficult to underestimate . Over the course of our lives, we gain and sometimes lose those who were our friends. Resonant events with which our time is rich also leave an imprint on relationships - both between people and entire nations.

The hero of our comic is Ernesto, a Cuban who voluntarily came to help the country where he studied and lived. Already during combat coordination, he sees how many different people there are among the Russian volunteers. And everyone is ready to fight side by side, help and cover each other.

At the front, friendship is more than friendship, it becomes a real military brotherhood. Courage, trust in each other and mutual assistance are often the key to victory here. And every day fate prepares fighters to test their best human qualities in difficult field conditions.📌You can download the comic using the links: RU|ENP.S. Special thanks to @rvkoteam, who centrally print and distribute our comics among military personnel on the front line.#Bakhmut#Russia#Ukraine@rybarWe hope you liked the comic from our artists. We will be glad to receive any support (here is a convenient link to payment via SBP).

event: Increase in Sauce Supplies to China

original:
Forwarded from: Kaliningrad.Ru
The Kaliningrad sauce manufacturer plans to increase supplies to China fourfold. Agroproduct LLC is developing new markets. The company wants to supply up to 24 containers per year to China.

“We’ll probably be shipping in a month. We are currently loading two containers, because there is a problem with raw materials,” said Pavel Skatkov, commercial director of Agroproduct.

The company is looking for opportunities to export products to other countries. In particular, they are considering cooperation with Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Armenia and Georgia.

description: A rare T-80UD 'Bereza' diesel tank was spotted at a Ukrainian Armed Forces training ground. The tank, produced in Kharkov in the 1980s, is equipped with a 6TD two-stroke diesel engine and has a power of 1000 horsepower. Only a few units of this tank remain operational in the Kyiv regime's armed formations.
original:
A rare diesel T-80UD "Bereza" in Ukraine was spotted at the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The militants demonstrated a rare copy of the T-80UD tank for the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Judging by the weather, the video was filmed quite recently. According to some reports, only a few units of such vehicles remain on the move in the armed formations of the Kyiv regime. They, like the T-84 Oplot, are preferred to be kept in the rear. Judging by the fact that the militants in the frame do not have personal weapons, helmets or body armor, the filming took place at one of the training grounds.

T-80UD "Birch" was produced for the Soviet army in Kharkov in the second half of the 80s. They differ from gas turbine versions by installing a 6TD two-stroke diesel engine with a power of 1000 horsepower. Most of the party was then sent to the Kantemirovskaya and Tamanskaya divisions.

Currently, these tanks have been taken out of service in Russia.

description: Colonel Magomedali Magomedzhanov, deputy commander of the 18th Army of Russia, died from wounds received during fighting. He was a seasoned military officer, having participated in four military operations, including in Syria, and commanded several marine brigades.
original:
The deputy commander of the 18th Army of Russia, Magomedali Magomedzhanov, died.

The death of the soldier was reported by the Public Chamber of Dagestan. Magomedzhanov died in a Sevastopol hospital from wounds received during the fighting.

Colonel Magomedzhanov was born in the village of Khlut in Dagestan. He participated in four military operations, including in Syria. Most recently he commanded the 61st separate Kirkenes Red Banner Marine Brigade of the Northern Fleet and served as deputy commander of the 18th Army.

The head of Dagestan, Sergei Melikov, said that the colonel previously commanded the 77th separate brigade in the 177th separate marine regiment of the Red Banner Caspian Flotilla, “eradicating terrorism in the North Caucasus and Dagestan in those years.”Rosguard Russia

She was known for anti-Semitic and racist calls and direct actions, and took part in the murders of Jews. It is known that Kurasya’s unit in May 1944 in the village of Krossienko killed 12 Jews (according to other information - 13) and robbed them.

In the book Fear: Anti-Semitism in Post-Auschwitz Poland, Professor Jan Gross of Princeton University described Kuras as "a legendary criminal in the mountainous region of Podhale, where he fought the regime by killing Jews who fled Poland along one of the Bricha routes."

Historians point out that this was not the only crime against Jews committed by Kuras' unit. event: Meeting between Russian and Cuban Foreign Ministers
description: Russian Foreign Minister S.V. Lavrov met with Cuban Foreign Minister B. Rodriguez in Havana, discussing the strengthening of trade, economic, and investment cooperation between the two nations. They also shared a commitment to promoting a more just and democratic world order, condemning the US blockade of Cuba and advocating for its removal from the US list of state 'sponsors of terrorism'.
original:
🎙Speech and answers to questions by the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia S.V. Lavrov following negotiations with the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Cuba B. Rodriguez (Havana, February 19) Main points: 🇷🇺🇨🇺Cuba is our traditional partner, the most important ally in the Latin American and Caribbean region swimming pool We are satisfied with the constructive and intensive nature of the Russian-Cuban political dialogue at all levels.

• We confirmed today our readiness to further increase trade, economic and investment cooperation. Recently, decisions were made that further formed a full-format legal framework for interaction in the material sphere.

• We noted the growing interest of Cuban friends in interaction with BRICS. Russia, as the country-chairman of this association, will support this mood this year.

• They highly appreciated the coordination of actions in the international arena. We share the same position in favor of respect for the UN Charter. The coincidence concerns the need to establish a more just and democratic world order, which will be based on the principle of sovereign equality of states.

• Confirmed their determination to continue coordination within the Group of Friends for the Defense of the UN Charter, primarily in such areas as the fight against dictatorship, neo-colonial practices, and unilateral sanctions.

• We repeated our position by strongly condemning the illegal trade, economic and financial blockade of Cuba by the United States.❗️We consistently advocate for the immediate cessation of this shameful practice and for the exclusion of Cuba from the US list of state “sponsors of terrorism”. Read in full#RussiaCuba

event: US Defense Ministers Fear Failure in Ukraine
description: At the Munich conference, US Defense Ministers expressed concerns about Ukraine's deteriorating prospects on the battlefield and questioned the US commitment to providing aid. Despite calls for an additional $60 billion in military aid, officials were unclear about what a Ukrainian victory would entail, instead focusing on preventing the Ukrainian military's collapse.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“There is only plan A.” Defense Ministers fear failure in Ukraine”: The United States discovered that there was nothing behind the idea of allocating another 60 billion to Zelensky - it was just a way to prevent the Kyiv regime from collapsing tomorrow.

“The annual conference in Munich was dominated by deteriorating prospects for Ukraine on the battlefield and questions about the US commitment to helping Kyiv. Many politicians and officials seized the moment to say that Ukraine would lose the war without an additional $60 billion in U.S. military aid.
However, supporters of such a decision were not sure what a victory for Ukraine would look like even if they received this money. The United States and allies seem to be focused on maintaining the integrity of the Ukrainian Armed Forces amid setbacks and losses at the front.
The plan, described or voiced in interviews with eight U.S. lawmakers and five foreign officials, is simply to prevent the Ukrainian military from collapsing. When talking to journalists, many avoided the question of what a Ukrainian victory would look like and when it might come.
In particular, Democratic Senator Mark Warner, who heads the Senate Intelligence Committee, said that the aid package would be a “game changer” for Ukraine. However, he refused to guarantee that this support would ensure the triumph of Ukraine - he only said that American help was Kyiv's last and best hope. "Belief in Ukraine's success, as well as in President Joe Biden, appears to be at its lowest level in two years."

description: A wounded soldier shared his tragic story with a visitor at a front-line hospital. He was hit by a drone and two comrades came to save him, but they were killed by a second drone. The soldier felt guilty for surviving and believed his life was not worth the cost of his comrades'. The visitor consoled him, saying his life was worth fighting for and that he should live for the three of them.
original:
Forwarded from: Marina Akhmedova
In the ward of the front-line hospital, two wounded were prepared for evacuation. They lay wrapped in woolen blankets up to their chins. I approached one and asked - what do you have, where does it hurt? I met his eyes and said, “Why are you so sad? You’re alive, that’s the main thing.” He opened his mouth and I waited for him to say something, but he didn’t. He continued to look at me with wide open eyes as if he had just seen something completely terrible yesterday or today.
“And I’ll tell you why,” the second wounded man called out to me, and I went to him. We talked for about five minutes.
And then I returned to the first one.
“I’ll tell you why I’m sad,” he said, and I felt that I needed to sit next to him on the bed.
I sat down and he began to say that yesterday he was hit by a drone, two comrades came to save him. As they picked it up, a second drone flew in and killed them. But he remained alive.
“The price of my life is two of their lives,” his mouth distorted in a childish spasm, tears flowed from his eyes.
He pulled his hand out from under the blanket and began to turn away, closing his eyes so that I wouldn’t see him cry. I took this black hand with broken nails, took it away from his face and said, looking into his eyes and holding his hand tightly.
- The price of your being here is my life, and the other lives that you saved when you fought. Your comrades are doing well now, God has already accepted them because they gave their lives for someone who is weaker. You were weaker. You would do the same.
I held his gaze and did not let him cry.
“It was during the day,” he said.
“That shows they were good people,” I said.
- Thank you.
- To you.
- My life is not worth it. How should I live?
- For three. What were their names?
- Tsiga and Aladon. I didn't know their names. Names are always extra information.

The orderlies came for him, I let go of his hand. He was again wrapped up to his chin. I said that I would stop by the church to pray for Tsig and Aladon. And it doesn’t matter that I don’t know their names, God knows who I mean, and names in this case are just extra information @marinaslovo

“So far, two people are talking about the collective security system - me and Putin. No one else,” he says.

He considers it impossible to reach the 1991 borders. I would like to keep the current ones. Why then did it all happen? Why did hundreds of thousands die? Yes, it’s not clear why. “They pulled the tiger by the whiskers,” and the tiger took it and fell. The Ukrainians finished the game. Now even Arestovich has left them.

description: Ukraine developed a remote-controlled evacuation platform, FoxTac, designed to rescue wounded soldiers. The four-wheel drive system enables movement on both wheels and tracks, and the platform is protected from dirt, allowing it to navigate difficult off-road terrain. The operator can control the robot from a safe distance of 700 meters, reducing the risk of harm to both the operator and the injured soldier.

"Specifically, this robot can be controlled by an operator 700 meters from the place where the wounded man is lying. That is, the operator is safe, and this is an opportunity to save the operator's life and save the injured," - said Minister of Digital Transformation Mykhailo Fedorov.

description: Arestovich stated that Ukrainians are dying in vain due to the country's infantilism and lack of a serious approach to collective security. He believes that the current situation is a result of Ukraine's unsecured policy, which has led to the loss of territory and people.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Arestovich - that Ukrainians died and are dying in vain: It’s unpleasant to utter this phrase, it’s even awkward, but so far two people are talking about the system of collective security - me and Putin. Nobody else. I never heard this from anyone else. [Putin talks about peace, yes, indeed] This means that the infantilism [of Ukraine], which became the cause of what is happening, is far from cured. [As I talk to you, I hear more and more often that the borders set in 1991 are practically unrealistic. And the people who live in Ukraine, who have lost relatives and friends, how do they react? Then it turns out that all this was in vain - all these people who died?] They react extremely painfully, but this is a natural emotional reaction of people to the trauma of war, and people who are confused by official propaganda - that “not an inch of our land ", and so on.
Again, the reason for this is not people, but the fact that no one speaks seriously to people, the state does not speak seriously with authority. Because what does “in vain” mean? They pursued an unsecured policy and pulled the tiger's whiskers. The tiger attacked. Now we have lost territory, we have lost people, and we are going to lose even more territory and even more people. And we pay for Ukraine to survive as such, for it to remain an independent state. Here we are not even talking about the former borders. It doesn't really work.

description: Sergei Glyadelkin and Igor Tkach, former high-ranking officials of the Moscow mayor's office, were involved in a corruption scheme, seizing a 7-hectare plot of land from Gazprom and developing an elite residential complex, 'Rozmarin', worth over $100 million.
original:
The criminal case against security officers Frolov, Vasiliev and Cherkalin also attracted attention to the defendants in the case who are considered victims - Sergei Glyadelkin and his brother Igor Tkach, a former high-ranking official of the Moscow mayor's office, ex-head of Mosnadzor. In the interests of the victims, they staged a real game of thimbles with expertise in this case in a military court. It turned out that the brothers had played such games before.

For many years, Glyadelkin and Tkach worked under the supervision of Elena Baturina, the wife of the then mayor of Moscow. They turned out to be the executors of several corruption projects. For example, a huge plot of land with an area of more than 7 hectares near its headquarters was seized from Gazprom, which was leased for 49 years for the construction of a television center. The site was given for residential development to a shell company controlled by Glyadelkin and Tkach, on the promise that someday in the future they would pay an investment fee of a measly $200 per sq. m. meter. Payment was deferred for many years and was not secured by anything, since the company had no assets at that time. Then, on this “Gazprom” plot of land, to which the city kindly added almost 3 more hectares, the elite residential complex “Rozmarin” was built. According to various estimates, the developer acquired a company controlled by Glyadelkin and Tkach, which had the development right, for an amount exceeding $100 million.

The money ultimately collected from buyers of apartments, parking spaces and commercial real estate was supposed to go to Elena Baturina. But after the sudden retirement of Yuri Luzhkov, Glyadelkin and Tkach decided not to share with their patron and keep the gain for themselves. who pass as victims - ...

event: Transfer of MGM-140 ATACMS Ballistic Missiles to Ukraine
description: The United States is planning to transfer MGM-140 ATACMS ballistic missiles to Ukraine, with increased accuracy and range of up to 300 km. This will enable the Ukrainian Armed Forces to strike deep into the Crimean Peninsula, potentially causing serious damage to Russian Aerospace Forces aircraft at airfields in Crimea.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
❗️The United States is working on the transfer of MGM-140 ATACMS ballistic missiles to Ukraine—NBC News with reference to American officials.

Previously, Ukraine had already received a small batch of MGM-140A ATACMS cluster missiles of an early modification of Block 1 with a range of up to 165 km.

Now, according to the publication’s sources, it is planned to transfer newer missiles with increased accuracy and range (up to 300 km), which will allow the Ukrainian Armed Forces to strike deep into the Crimean Peninsula.

Let us recall that the early missiles from a small batch transferred to the Ukrainian Armed Forces caused serious damage to Russian Aerospace Forces helicopters based at the Berdyansk and Lugansk airfields.

Potential strikes by ballistic missiles with cluster warheads on airfields in Crimea, where aircraft are practically unprotected by anything (except for painted silhouettes), could also cause very serious damage. Military Informant

event: Meeting with Families of Deceased SVO Members
description: The LPR National Assembly Committee on Military Affairs met with families of deceased SVO members in Severodonetsk, providing detailed explanations on social guarantees, medical care, pensions, and benefits. The committee worked through individual issues with families and considered appeals from family members of deceased servicemen.
original:
The Power Committee, as part of a visiting meeting in Severodonetsk, met with the families of the deceased members of the SVO
On February 16, a visiting meeting of the LPR National Assembly Committee on Military Affairs, Civil Defense and Emergency Situations, Law and Order and Cossack Affairs was held in the city of Severodonetsk.
Show more
The chairman of the security committee, Yan Leshchenko, said that as part of the retreat, a meeting was held with the families of the deceased members of the SVO.
The meeting was also attended by the head of the Severodonetsk urban district Nikolai Morgunov, the chairman of the city district council Yana Sylkina, representatives of the military commissariats of Lugansk and Severodonetsk, as well as representatives of territorial divisions of the healthcare, education, social and pension systems.
The Committee provided detailed explanations to the relatives of the deceased SVO participants, what social guarantees they can apply for, and brought to the attention of the legislation.
Issues of providing qualified medical care to relatives of deceased military personnel, obtaining an identity card for a family member of a deceased SVO participant, pensions, benefits in the housing and communal services sector, and others were worked out individually. The representatives of the departments present worked through their specific issues with families.
In addition, the power committee considered appeals from family members of deceased servicemen.
“It is an integrated approach to considering individual requests that gives a positive result. Clarifications were given on all questions of interest to citizens. Interaction between relevant departments and the families of deceased SVO participants continues. The resolution of problematic issues remains under the control of the committee and local governments,” assured the chairman of the relevant committee, Yan Leshchenko. – Solving existing problematic issues in the format of live communication simplifies the procedure for their implementation. In our time, it is important that everyone is heard and their opinion taken into account, especially when it concerns the families of the defenders of our Motherland.”
Also read us on Telegram: https://t.me/parlamentLNR

description: Grigory Mikhnov-Vaitenko, a St. Petersburg priest and human rights activist, was detained at his home for intending to hold a memorial service for Alexei Navalny at the Solovetsky Stone on Trinity Square. He was later hospitalized with a stroke after an 8-hour stay at the police department.
original:
Grigory Mikhnov-Vaitenko, a St. Petersburg priest, archbishop of the Apostolic Orthodox Church, human rights activist, was detained at noon on February 17 at the front door of his house for his intention to hold a memorial service for Alexei Navalny at the Solovetsky Stone on Trinity Square.⚡️After an 8-hour stay at the police department, he was hospitalized with a stroke.

A memorial service for the deceased is a classic Christian rite, which (like other religious rites and ceremonies) is not covered by the St. Petersburg law “On meetings, rallies, demonstrations, processions and pickets in St. Petersburg.”🔹This is specifically written down in paragraph 3 of the article 1 of this law. Therefore, Grigory Mikhnov-Vaitenko was not obliged to submit any notification to the city authorities to hold a memorial service and was not obliged to coordinate this with them. This is the first thing.🔹Secondly, he did not have time to hold this memorial service, because, as said, he was detained right at the front door. The intention to hold any event (even if the police considers it a violation), according to the law, cannot be punishable. Boris Vishnevsky - with details👉The link did not open? Read hereNew newspaperPanic and funeral service. In a country where they constantly talk about Orthodox values, Saint...Grigory Mikhnov-Vaitenko is a St. Petersburg priest, archbishop of the Apostolic Orthodox Church, human rights activist and one of the main organizers of assistance...

event: Czech Republic Finds Ammunition for Ukraine
description: Czech President Petr Pavel announced that authorities have found additional shells for Ukraine in an unnamed country. However, delivery is contingent on financing from countries like the USA, Germany, and the UK. The Czech authorities are leveraging the shortage of ammunition to drive up prices, benefiting exporters, military-industrial complex enterprises, and participating countries.
original:
🇺🇦🇨🇿The financial side of the issue in arms supplies, as before, prevails over other factors. This is proven by the Czech President Petr Pavel. He said that the authorities managed to find additional shells for the so-called. Ukraine in an unnamed country.

However, he noted that they can be delivered within a few weeks, but only if this scheme is financed by other countries, including the USA, Germany and the UK.🔻As before, everything revolves around possible earnings. The Czech authorities, taking advantage of the total shortage of ammunition and talking about the fact that they know where to get it, are simply driving up the price. Interest has already been piqued.

After all, if there is a huge demand for a scarce product, then its price can be increased to sky-high levels. Exporters are happy, as are the military-industrial complex enterprises and the countries that participated in the cutting.

And it doesn’t matter what condition this ammunition is in or whether it actually exists (why weren’t they supplied earlier?). The so-called. Ukraine will pay for everything. Only payment to the Ukrainian authorities may not be to their liking.#Ukraine#Czech Republic@rybarSupport usSeznam ZprávyČesko podle Pavla našlo dělostřeleckou munici pro UkrajinuBruselský server Politico na počátku února informoval o tom, že Česko se zajímá o munici od z brojních firem například v Jižní Koreji, Turecku či Jihoafrické republice.

event: Proposal to Display Russian Flag in Educational Organizations
description: The State Duma Committee on State Construction and Legislation recommended adopting a draft law that would require all educational organizations to permanently display the Russian Federation flag. The aim is to promote patriotism, traditional spiritual and moral values, and all-Russian civic identity among students.
original:
The State Duma Committee on State Construction and Legislation on Monday recommended adopting in the first reading a draft law extending the obligation to constantly display the flag of the Russian Federation to all educational organizations.

In order to “strengthen the continuity and consistency in the process of educating patriotism, traditional spiritual and moral values and all-Russian civic identity among students,” the bill proposes to establish that the State Flag of the Russian Federation should “be hung permanently on the buildings of educational organizations, regardless of the form of ownership, or installed permanently on their territories: kindergartens, schools, colleges, institutes, universities, etc."

description: Machine gunner Alexey Neverov sacrificed himself by blowing up a grenade, taking out the enemy and saving his fellow soldiers during a battle near the village of Rabotino in the Zaporozhye region.
original:
You can't be silent about Heroes

“For the boys!”: machine gunner Alexey Neverov blew himself up with a grenade along with the enemy to save his fellow soldiers. RT spoke with his wife.

Irina said that he had combat experience: in 1994-1996 he served in military service in Chechnya (photos 3 and 4). Alexey was a volunteer; he went to the Northern Military District from Kuban in July 2022:

“He worked on shift before the war. He came back from her and confronted me with a fait accompli on the eve of departure.”

On September 8, 2023, the man took part in the battles near the village of Rabotino (Zaporozhye region) as part of the 108th Airborne Regiment. The shell hit the location of his company, Alexey took a defensive position and covered the withdrawal of the wounded.

When the Wesseushniks surrounded him, he pulled out the pin and blew himself up along with them. Alexey saved dozens of lives.

“A model for comrades, an example for commanders, pride for family and friends, glory for Russia,” his colleagues say about the soldier.
They are confident that his feat is worthy of a medal, and ask to nominate him for the award.

description: The latest issue of Fisherman Comics, No. 14, explores the theme of foreigners in the Russian and Ukrainian armed forces. The comic tells the story of Ernesto, a Cuban volunteer who joins the Russian forces and forms strong bonds with his comrades.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
⚡️🇷🇺🇺🇦🖍#Fisherman Comics No. 14: Once upon a time near Artyomovsk The new week begins with a new issue of our comic: this time we decided to touch on the topic of foreigners in the ranks of the Russian Armed Forces and Ukrainian formations. It would seem that here and there there are people from abroad who find themselves on opposite sides of the barricades.

But there is always a difference: first of all, it is a question of motivation and the reasons that prompted people to take part in someone else’s conflict. Synopsis: The circle of communication and connections that we form with people are certainly important and have an influence on us that is difficult to underestimate . Over the course of our lives, we gain and sometimes lose those who were our friends. Resonant events with which our time is rich also leave an imprint on relationships - both between people and entire nations.

The hero of our comic is Ernesto, a Cuban who voluntarily came to help the country where he studied and lived. Already during combat coordination, he sees how many different people there are among the Russian volunteers. And everyone is ready to fight side by side, help and cover each other.

At the front, friendship is more than friendship, it becomes a real military brotherhood. Courage, trust in each other and mutual assistance are often the key to victory here. And every day fate prepares fighters to test their best human qualities in difficult field conditions.📌You can download the comic using the links: RU|ENP.S. Special thanks to @rvkoteam, who centrally print and distribute our comics among military personnel on the front line.#Bakhmut#Russia#Ukraine@rybarWe hope you liked the comic from our artists. We will be glad to receive any support (here is a convenient link to payment via SBP).

description: The Kota evacuation group rescued two wounded attack aircraft, 'Butcher' and 'Kosha', from the battlefield. 'Butcher' was hit 300 times by a kamikaze drone, while 'Kosha' was wounded by a 'Baba Yaga' attack. Thanks to their armored armor and the evacuation efforts, everyone survived. The rescue was carried out by 'Cat' on an ATV, who is a student of medic 'Santa'.
original: Rescue of wounded attack aircraft by the Kota evacuation group. The first one (“Butcher”) was hit three hundred times by a kamikaze drone that flew in carrying a shot from a grenade launcher. The second one (“Kosha”) was wounded by being dropped from “Baba Yaga”. If it weren't for the armored armor, he would have been finished (wear SIBZ!). Everyone was evacuated by "Cat" from the battlefield on an ATV, everyone survived. In general, it’s interesting to watch how a fighter evolves. I knew Seryoga “Kot” as the reckless Kremensky Rambo, who rushed headlong into the most dangerous tasks of his battalion, dashingly and, as it seemed to me, sometimes in vain, risking his life. He didn't feel sorry for her. But now a year has passed and I can already see how he values and saves the lives of others by becoming a member of the evacuation group. One of the most dangerous and noble specializations in war. At the end of the video, one of the rescued warriors thanks “Santa,” the medic, whom we also talked a little about earlier. So “Cat” is the student of that same “Santa”. I’ll add on my own behalf: “Santa”, thank you for making a desperately useful rescuer of our soldiers out of just a Desperate “Cat”! @zimenkin

event: Presentation of Arman and Azarakhsh Missile Defense Systems
description: Iran unveiled its new Arman missile defense system, capable of attacking 6 targets simultaneously at a distance of 120-180 km, and the Azarakhsh low-altitude air defense system, which can recognize and destroy targets up to 50 km with four ready-to-fire missiles. The development of these systems aims to address Iran's shortage of long-range anti-aircraft missiles.
original:
Iran presented new air defense and missile defense systems. The Arman missile system, which was presented last week, can simultaneously attack 6 targets at a distance of 120 to 180 km. "Azarakhsh" is capable of recognizing and destroying targets at a range of up to 50 km with four ready-to-fire missiles.

Iran, having enough modern medium- and short-range air defense systems, is experiencing some shortage of long-range anti-aircraft missiles. And the development and implementation of the Arman complex is part of the solution to this problem.

The Arman and Azarakhsh complexes were designed by order of the Aerospace Forces of the IRGC and the Army Air Defense Forces. Iran's air defense forces are part of both the army and the IRGC and are coordinated through the Khatam al-Anbiya operational headquarters, which commands the country's unified air defense system.@wargonzo*our project exists on the funds of subscribers, map for help4276 3801 4149 1378TelegramIRNA IN RUSSIAN🔻 Missile systems "Arman" and "Azarakhsh" presented

The body of the traitor Kuzminov.
The degenerate doomed two of his colleagues to death. Numerous gunshot wounds were found in the body. The car in which the killers allegedly fled was found burned 20 kilometers from the murder scene.
